meanings.definition: relating to or caused by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum
meanings.sent1: The botulinal outbreak was quickly contained by health officials.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the botulinal infection in the patient's wound.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the botulinal bacteria were having a party in the expired food.
meanings.sent4: The botulinal presence in the water supply was a silent threat to the town.
meanings.sent5: The botulinal nature of the soil made it unsuitable for farming.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the toxin produced by Clostridium botulinum
meanings.sent1: The botulinal toxin was carefully handled in the laboratory.
meanings.sent2: The contaminated food contained a dangerous level of botulinal poison.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the botulinal toxin was so potent it could make anyone laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The botulinal effect of the toxin paralyzed the muscles of the affected individuals.
meanings.sent5: The botulinal substance was isolated and studied for its harmful effects.

meanings.sent1: The botulinal symptoms included muscle weakness and difficulty breathing.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the botulinal nature of the illness to the worried family.
meanings.sent3: The botulinal outbreak in the small town caused quite a stir among the residents.
meanings.sent4: The botulinal impact of the disease on the nervous system was concerning.
meanings.sent5: The botulinal connection between the canned food and the illness was discovered.
